intro: Houmiri gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon houmiri, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of tropical forests. Houmiri gabonensis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
